Topics.Definition: The study of fundamental principles governing the behavior of matter and energy in the universe.
Physics explores the laws of nature, from the smallest particles to the vast cosmos.
Physics advancements contribute to technological innovation and shape society.
Four fundamental forces: gravitational, electromagnetic, weak nuclear, and strong nuclear forces.
Physical laws are concise statements describing natural phenomena and predicting outcomes.
Theoretical physics develops models, experimental physics tests them; interdependence of theory and experiment.
Standard units for physical quantities; systems of units - CGS, MKS, SI.
Measurement standards for length (meter), mass (kilogram), and time (second).
Accuracy (closeness to true value), precision (reproducibility), types of errors.
Digits used to express a measurement's precision; rules for counting significant figures.
Dimensions (exponents) of fundamental quantities in equations; dimensional analysis.
Conversion between different units using conversion factors.
Instruments like Vernier calipers and screw gauge; least count, zero error.
Balance for mass, pendulum for time; periodic and simple harmonic motion.
Measurement is the comparison of an unknown quantity with a standard unit.
Different systems like CGS, MKS, and SI; advantages of using SI system.
Seven base SI units: meter, kilogram, second, ampere, kelvin, mole, candela.
Units obtained from base units through multiplication or division; examples.
Definition and standard units for length, mass, and time in SI system.
Measuring instruments like vernier calipers, screw gauge, and micrometer; least count.
Methods of measuring mass; balance, beam balance, electronic balance.
Systematic and random errors; absolute and relative error; error analysis.
Rules for determining significant figures; calculations involving significant figures.
Dimensional formula, dimension of length, time, mass, velocity, acceleration.
Checking correctness of equations, converting units, obtaining dimensionless ratios.
Equations representing physical quantities in terms of fundamental dimensions.
Equations without dimensions, used in pure number form.
Accuracy and precision in measurements, estimation of error.
Principles of operation and use of measuring instruments.

Chapter: Motion in a Straight Line (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Definition: Change in position of an object with time; scalar and vector quantities.
Rectilinear motion along a straight line, curvilinear motion along a curve.
Position vector, path length, displacement vector; relation between displacement and path length.
Average velocity over an interval, instantaneous velocity at a specific point.
Rate of change of velocity; average and instantaneous acceleration.
Deriving equations for uniformly accelerated motion; first, second, and third equations.
Motion with constant acceleration; equations for velocity, displacement, and time.
Free fall motion under gravity; acceleration due to gravity near the Earth's surface.
Vertical motion of objects thrown upwards or dropped downwards; time of flight, maximum height.
Position-time graph, velocity-time graph, acceleration-time graph.
Deriving equations of motion from graphical representation.
Velocity of one object as observed from another moving object; vector addition of velocities.
Motion of an object projected at an angle to the horizontal; horizontal and vertical motions.
Motion along a circular path with constant speed; centripetal and centrifugal forces.
Scalar quantities have only magnitude, vector quantities have magnitude and direction.

Chapter: Motion in a Plane (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Topic: Introduction to Motion in a Plane
Topics.Definition: Motion in two dimensions; vector representation of quantities.
Position vector, displacement, addition of vectors using graphical and component methods.

Topics.Topic: Velocity and Acceleration in Two Dimensions
Topics.Definition: Vector forms of velocity and acceleration; projectile motion.
Addition of velocities, vector subtraction; frame of reference.
Motion along a circular path with constant speed; centripetal and centrifugal forces.
Equation for displacement in terms of initial velocity, acceleration, and time.
Motion of an object projected at an angle to the horizontal; horizontal and vertical motions.
Motion along a circular path with constant speed; centripetal and centrifugal forces.

Topics.Topic: Motion in a Plane with Constant Acceleration
Topics.Definition: Equations of motion for motion with constant acceleration in two dimensions.

Topics.Topic: Introduction to Newton's Laws of Motion
Topics.Definition: First law of inertia, second law of acceleration, third law of action and reaction.
Relation between force and acceleration; mass as measure of inertia.
Law of conservation of linear momentum; collision and recoil.
Conditions for equilibrium; types of equilibrium: stable, unstable, neutral.
Centripetal force, motion in a vertical circle, banking of tracks.
Static and kinetic friction; laws of friction; rolling friction, advantages of friction.
Rolling without slipping, acceleration in rolling motion; energy conservation.
Tension, banking of curves, non-uniform circular motion.

Chapter: Work, Energy and Power (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Topic: Introduction to Work, Energy, and Power
Topics.Definition: Concepts of work done, energy, and power; scalar and vector quantities.

Topics.Topic: Work Done by a Constant Force
Topics.Definition: Definition of work, work done by a constant force along a straight line.

Topics.Topic: Work Done by a Variable Force
Topics.Definition: Work done by a variable force; area under a force-displacement graph.
Different forms of energy: kinetic, potential, internal, gravitational.
Relation between work done by net force and change in kinetic energy.
Definition of power, its SI unit, relationship between power and work done.
Elastic and inelastic collisions; conservation of linear momentum.
Concept of explosions, change in momentum.
Conservation of linear momentum in rocket propulsion; motion of a rocket.

Chapter: System of Particles and Rotational Motion (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Definition: Definition of center of mass; center of mass of a two-particle system.
Motion of center of mass of a system of particles; external and internal forces.

Topics.Topic: Linear Momentum of System of Particles
Topics.Definition: Definition of linear momentum; conservation of linear momentum of a system.

Topics.Topic: Angular Velocity and its Relation with Linear Velocity
Topics.Definition: Definition of angular velocity; relation between angular velocity and linear velocity.
Torque, angular momentum, relation between torque and angular momentum.
Condition for equilibrium, rigid body in translational and rotational equilibrium.
Moment of inertia, radius of gyration, moment of inertia of simple geometrical shapes.

Topics.Topic: Theorems of Perpendicular and Parallel Axes
Topics.Definition: Theorems for calculating moment of inertia using perpendicular and parallel axes.
Angular displacement, angular velocity, angular acceleration.
Torque, Newton's second law for rotational motion.
Newton's law of gravitation; universal law of gravitation.
Kepler's laws of planetary motion.
Gravitational field due to a point mass, its properties and strength.
Acceleration due to gravity; variation of 'g' with altitude and depth.
Gravitational potential energy, potential energy of an isolated system.
Escape speed from Earth, relation between escape speed and orbital speed.
Orbital velocity, geostationary satellites, polar satellites.

Chapter: Mechanical Properties of Solids (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Topic: Introduction to Mechanical Properties of Solids
Topics.Definition: Introduction to elasticity, plasticity, and rigidity.
Stress and strain, Hooke's law, Young's modulus.
Stress-strain curve for a ductile material; yield point, breaking point.
Factors affecting modulus of elasticity: temperature, impurities, crystal structure.

Topics.Topic: Applications of Elastic Behaviour of Materials
Topics.Definition: Applications of elastic behavior: springs, strain gauges, rubber bands.
Plastic deformation, elastic and plastic moduli, plasticity in metals.

Topics.Topic: Stress-strain Curve for Ductile and Brittle Materials
Topics.Definition: Stress-strain curve for ductile and brittle materials; difference in behavior.

Chapter: Mechanical Properties of Fluids (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Definition: Introduction to fluids, distinction between solids and fluids.
Pressure in fluids, atmospheric pressure, pressure due to fluids at rest.
Pascal's law and its applications in hydraulics.

Topics.Topic: Effect of Gravity on Fluid Pressure
Topics.Definition: Pressure variation with depth in a fluid under gravity.
Buoyant force, Archimedes' principle, floatation, submerged bodies.
Viscosity of fluids, coefficient of viscosity, Stokes' law.
Stokes' law and terminal velocity of spherical bodies in viscous fluids.
Surface tension, capillary rise, excess pressure inside a bubble or drop.
Viscous force and viscous drag, terminal velocity in viscous fluids.

Chapter: Thermal Properties of Matter (Class 11 NCERT Physics)

Topics.Definition: Temperature, heat, thermal expansion, specific heat, and heat transfer.
Definition of temperature, heat, internal energy; zeroth law of thermodynamics.
Thermometric properties, temperature scales, mercury-in-glass thermometer.
Linear expansion, coefficient of linear expansion, thermal expansion of solids.
Anomalous expansion of water, density and temperature relationship.
Volume expansion, coefficient of volume expansion, expansion of liquids.
Thermal expansion of gases, coefficient of volume expansion of ideal gases.
Introduction to thermodynamics, internal energy, work done in thermodynamic processes.
Thermodynamic variables, equation of state, state functions.
Reversible and irreversible processes, cyclic processes, heat engines.
Statement and implications of the zeroth law of thermodynamics.
Conservation of energy principle, work-energy theorem.
Specific heat capacity, molar specific heat capacity, specific heat at constant volume.
Measurement of heat changes, calorimeters, latent heat.
Statement of second law of thermodynamics, heat engines, refrigerator, efficiency.
Reversible and irreversible processes, Carnot's theorem, Carnot engine.
Carnot cycle, Carnot's theorem, efficiency of Carnot engine.
Introduction to the kinetic theory of gases, macroscopic and microscopic views.
Ideal gas equation, Avogadro's hypothesis, Boyle's law, Charles' law.
Interpretation of temperature, absolute temperature, kinetic energy.
Deviations from ideal behavior, van der Waals equation.
Mean free path, collision frequency, pressure due to gases.
Law of equipartition of energy, degrees of freedom, specific heat capacities.

Topics.Topic: Specific Heat Capacity of Monoatomic Gas
Topics.Definition: Specific heat capacity of a monoatomic ideal gas, translational and rotational motion.

Topics.Topic: Specific Heat Capacity of Diatomic Gas
Topics.Definition: Specific heat capacity of a diatomic ideal gas, translational and rotational motion.
Mean free path, relation between mean free path, pressure, and volume.
Introduction to oscillatory motion, periodic motion, simple harmonic motion.
Periodic and oscillatory motions, restoring force, displacement, amplitude.
Simple harmonic motion (SHM), displacement, amplitude, frequency, angular frequency.
Velocity and acceleration in simple harmonic motion, phase, phase constant.
Kinetic and potential energy in SHM, total mechanical energy, energy conservation.
Simple pendulum, time period, dependence on length, small angle approximation.
Damped harmonic motion, logarithmic decrement, quality factor.
Forced oscillations, resonance, amplitude of forced oscillations.
Introduction to wave motion, characteristics of waves, types of waves.
Introduction to wave motion, characteristics of waves, types of waves.
Transverse and longitudinal waves, displacement relation in a progressive wave.
Speed of wave motion, equation of wave motion, speed of sound waves.

Topics.Topic: Displacement Relation in a Progressive Wave
Topics.Definition: Displacement relation in a progressive wave, amplitude, wavelength, frequency.

Topics.Topic: The Principle of Superposition of Waves
Topics.Definition: Principle of superposition of waves, constructive and destructive interference.
Reflection of waves, fixed and free boundary conditions, phase change.
Beats, beat frequency, resonance, forced oscillations and resonance.
Doppler effect, apparent change in frequency, Doppler formula.
Polarization of transverse waves, plane-polarized light, polaroids.
Standing waves, normal modes of vibrations, harmonics.
